Key Match Events: Alperen Sengun had 23 points, Jalen Green added 22 and the Houston Rockets built a big lead early in the second half and sailed to a 110-99 victory over the Dallas Mavericks on Wednesday night.
Houston used a 21-8 run to take a 61-52 lead into halftime.
Houston then opened the second half with an 11-4 spurt that pushed it to 72-56 with nine minutes left in the third.
Houston’s 32-12 run to end the first half and start the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyrie Irving (shoulder), Klay Thompson (illness) and Dereck Lively II (hip) returned after sitting out Monday.
Naji Marshall remained out serving a four-game suspension for his role in a fight against the Suns.
Post-Match Reflections: Mavericks: Lost for the third time in four games playing without Luka Doncic, who strained his calf on Christmas Day. They’ll need to find a way to win without the star, who will be out at least a month.
Rockets: Didn’t miss a beat without the bench scoring of Amen Thompson, who served the first of a two-game suspension for a fight with Miami’s Tyler Herro Sunday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston was up by 14 entering the fourth and maintained a double-digit lead throughout the quarter.
Quentin Grimes led the Mavericks with 17 points off the bench. Thompson and Irving added 16 each.
Houston’s victory was helped by making 18 of 23 free throws compared to just 8 of 16 by Dallas.
